thread.title: Record 3.6M New Yorkers sign up for Obamacare - NY Daily News
thread.title_full: Record 3.6M New Yorkers sign up for Obamacare - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Record 3.6M New Yorkers sign up for Obamacare - NY Daily News
text:
ALBANY — A record 3.6 million New Yorkers used the state’s Obamacare exchange to obtain health coverage for 2017, a 28% increase from a year ago, state health officials announced Wednesday.
Nearly 50,000 people signed up in the final two days before the Jan. 31 deadline, officials added. Tuesday was the exchange website’s busiest day ever, with nearly 3 million page views.
The surge in enrollment came despite vows by President Trump and Congressional Republicans to repeal the Affordable Care Act, which created the program.
"New Yorkers now have access to affordable health insurance coverage, giving hundreds of thousands of previously uninsured individuals economic and healthcare security,” said Donna Frescatore, executive director of the exchange.
Republican lawmakers starting to worry about ‘Trumpcare’ 
The enrollment figures included more than 2.4 million people who enrolled in Medicaid, 242,880 who signed up for private insurance plans, and 299,214 children qualified for the state’s Child Health Plus program.
Another 665,234 people signed up for the Essential Plan, a state-run and federally funded coverage plan for people making up to twice the federal poverty level. Enrollment in the Essential Plan jumped 75% from a year ago.
Bill Hammond, director of health policy for the Empire Center, said the Health Department’s numbers are somewhat misleading because the bulk of the enrollments came from Medicaid. The number of users who signed up for private insurance actually dropped nearly 11% from a year ago, he added.
“That to me is a sign of trouble with a private part of the exchange,” Hammond said.
